Commercial Banks.description:
This is a list of commercial banks with International Authorization in Nigeria, arranged alphabetically. 
 A commercial bank is a financial institution which accepts deposits from the public and gives loans for the purposes of consumption and investment to make profit.

Access Bank Plc.description:
Access Bank plc, commonly known as Access Bank, is a Nigerian multinational commercial bank, owned by Access Bank Group. It is licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria, the national banking regulator. Originally a corporate bank, they expanded into personal and business banking in 2012. 

Access Bank and Diamond Bank merged on April 1, 2019. In conclusion of its merger with Diamond Bank, Access Bank unveiled its new logo, signalling the commencement of a new enlarged banking entity. The bank employs more than 28,000 people in 2021, After the merger, with more than 42 million of customers, Access Bank plc became the largest bank in Africa by customer base, and the largest bank in Nigeria by asset. 

As of September 2021, in addition to Nigeria, Access Bank plc has subsidiaries in Mozambique, Zambia, Congo, Sierra Leone, Rwanda, Gambia, Ghana, Kenya, South Africa, and in the United Kingdom. Access Bank Group also maintains representative offices in China, India, Lebanon and United Arab Emirates.

codes.title: Access Bank USSD Code Registration
codes.description:
To start using the Access USSD ussd, you’ll need to enroll and activate it on the mobile number linked to your Access bank account. 

Access bank transfer USSD ussd, simply dial *901#, simply follow the steps below: 

-Dial *901# with your registered Access bank phone number. 
-Click on ‘Transfer’. 
-Enter the last six (6) digits of your Debit Card number (Note, you will be prompted to input your Date of Birth if you do not have an active debit card). 
-Next, enter your Access account number. 
-Create a 4-digit PIN. 

Now you’re done with that Access short ussd registration.

codes.title: Access Bank USSD
codes.description: Access bank short ussd allows you to perform transactions like transfer money, check account balance, airtime top-up, pay bills, get account statement, BVN, and a lot more. *901# Access USSD ussd is the convenient, secure, and easy way to perform your banking transactions without an internet-enabled device that features an online connection.

codes.title: Access Diamond USSD
codes.description: Access / Diamond bank short ussd allows you to also perform transactions like transfer money, check account balance, airtime top-up, pay bills, get account statement, BVN, and a lot more, just like the Direct access bank ussd ussd.

codes.title: Self-Service
codes.description: Access Bank Plc launches *901*911# Self-Service USSD to control fraud, this is to safeguard the investments and savings of its customers.

codes.title: Merchant Payment
codes.description: No description available yet :(

codes.title: Self-airtime Purchase
codes.description: The Access bank ussd to buy airtime for self is *901*Amount# (example, *901*100#)

codes.title: Airtime to Others
codes.description: Access bank bank ussd to buy airtime for others like friends and family is *901*Amount*Phone Number# (example, *901*100*08012345678#)

codes.title: Data Purchase
codes.description: Access bank bank ussd to buy data for yourself and others like friends and family is *901*8#

codes.title: Transfer
codes.description:
To transfer money from Access bank account to other banks in Nigeria using the Access bank transfer ussd, simply dial *901*Amount*Account Number#. 
 For example, dial *901*10000*1234567890#, complete the payment by entering your 4 digits security PIN.

codes.title: Check Balance
codes.description: Access bank USSD ussd to check balance is *901*00#. This ussd to check account balance in Access bank is available for all registered customers in Access bank Plc and most be done on their phone number that’s linked to the account.

codes.title: Check BVN
codes.description: The official USSD ussd to check your Access bank BVN is *565*0#. Also, make sure that the phone number you dialed the Access USSD ussd for bank verification number is linked to the account.

codes.title: Check Account Number
codes.description:
To check the Access bank account number using USSD ussd, follow the steps below: 
  - Dial *901# with the phone number linked to the Access bank account. 
 - On the menu options, select option 4 “Other services” 
 - Next, select option 4 again “Enquiry service” 
 - Finally, select option 3 “Account Number Enquiry”. 
 Alternatively, dial *901*5# with the SIM card used in receiving alert then enter your Access bank USSD security PIN. After this, wait like 1 or 2 seconds your Access bank account number will be fetched from the bank’s server and shown to you.

codes.title: PIN change/reset
codes.description: If you forget your Access USSD security PIN, simply dial *901*0# to get the PIN reset.

codes.title: Access bank block ussd
codes.description:
To lock your Access Bank account during an emergency period like loss of your ATM card, and other valuable bank information, simply dial *901*919#. 
 Within 3 minutes after dialing, the account will be locked. You can also call Access bank customer care service on 012802500 and request to block your account. 
 Note that you’re only to dial the Access bank account blocking ussd in emergency cases, after exposing your banking details to fraudsters either online or offline. 
 Note: Unfortunately, there’s no Access USSD ussd to unlock your Access bank account after it has been locked. Hence, you’re to visit any Access bank branch to get your account to unblock.

Fidelity Bank Plc.description: Fidelity Bank, also known as Fidelity Bank Plc., is a commercial bank in Nigeria. It is licensed as a commercial bank with international authorization, by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), the central bank and national banking regulator. Fidelity Bank has grown from a marginal player in 1987, into a stable and respectable banking institution. Notably in 2005, Fidelity Bank acquired FSB International Bank Plc (“FSB”) and Manny Bank Plc (“Manny”) to create one of the top 10 Nigerian banks. In 2011, the Bank was ranked the 7th most capitalized bank in Nigeria, 25th most capitalized bank on the African continent.[citation needed] Also, following its renewed retail and digital banking drive, Fidelity Bank was ranked the 4th best bank in Nigeria in the retail market segment in the KPMG Banking Industry Customer Satisfaction Survey (BICSS) in 2017. As of December 2017, Fidelity Bank Plc. had total assets estimated at over US$4.2 billion (NGN:1.4 + trillion), and shareholders' equity in excess of US$610 million (NGN:203 billion). The Bank serves its 4 + million customers through its multiple distribution channels including 240 business offices, 775 ATMs and 4,346 POSs. The Bank currently has over 400,000 diverse shareholders. It was listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange in May 2005 and has consistently paid dividends annually in the last 12 years even in the most turbulent periods in the Nigerian Banking Industry. According to BGL Plc, Fidelity Bank Plc had a market capitalisation of NGN:37,072,109,685.76

codes.title: Fidelity Bank USSD Code Activation
codes.description:
As an individual account holder in Fidelity Bank, you are already profile to be able to use the *770# service. However, you must now activate your access by going through the following steps below if you wish to use the *770# for your day-to-day transactions. 

Here are the step-by-step procedures to register on Fidelity Bank *770# USSD code: 

-Dial *770*00*#
-Enter your account number
-Create PIN
-Confirm PIN
-You will be required to enter an alternative phone number. Input ‘0’ if you don’t have one.
-Enter PIN
-Submit

codes.title: How to Transfer to Other Fidelity Bank Account
codes.description:
You can transfer your funds to other Fidelity Bank accounts as well as other banks. Here is how to transfer your funds using *770#. You just need to follow any of the two steps below:

-Dial *770#
-Press ‘1’ to proceed
-Select ‘4’ from the menu displayed
-Enter amount
-Enter destination account number
-You will be asked if you want to save beneficiary or not
-Select destination bank
-Confirm the fee
-Submit

OR

Simply dial  *770*Destination Account*Amount#

 The fees varies from N0-N5,000 – N10, N5,000 and above – N25

codes.title: Pay Bills
codes.description:
You can also use your Fidelity Bank USSD code *770# to pay all your TV, electricity, and all other utility bills. Easy and convenient.

-Dial *770#
-Choose Pay bills
-Choose the biller name
-Choose your plan
-Enter amount
-Submit

You can do this up here or simply dial *770*Biller Code*Amount#

Note that this will cost you N105

codes.title: Self Recharge
codes.description:
You can load airtime for your self, simple follow this procedure:

-Dial *770#
-Choose Airtime
-Enter Your phone’
-Enter amount

You can also load airtime by dialing *770*AMOUNT#

codes.title: Recharge for Others
codes.description:
You can load airtime for others, simple follow this procedure:

-Dial *770#
-Choose Airtime
-Enter their phone’
-Enter amount

You can also load airtime by dialing *770*PHONE NUMBER*AMOUNT#

codes.title: Check Balance
codes.description:
How to Check Balance on Fidelity Bank:

-Dial *770*0#
-Choose Balance
-Enter PIN

you can also check your balance by dialing *770*0#

Note that this will cost you N20

codes.title: Open a Fidelity Bank Account
codes.description:
If you are not yet a fedelity bank account user, you can open a fedelity bank account with on your phone, simply dial *770*01# and follow the on screen message:

-Select an account opening option (Select Option 1 if you have your BVN and Option 2 if you don’t)
-Enter your first name First Name
-Enter your middle name
-Enter your last name
-Select your gender
-Enter your account officer code or press ‘0’ if you don’t have one
-Enter your date of birth
-Press 1 to confirm your details and proceed

But you will still have to go to their bank to complete your registration

codes.title: Block Card
codes.description: If you lost your credit card or it got stolen, then you can block your credit card using the above USSD code

codes.title: Get Aaccount Number/BVN
codes.description: If you need to check your account number or your BVN, simple use this USSD code above

codes.title: Cardless Withdrawal
codes.description: If by chance you find your self without your ATM card and you want to make a withdraw, then this code is what you will need

codes.title: Change PIN
codes.description: Use this code above to change your USSD bank PIN

First City Monument Bank Limited.description: First City Monument Bank (FCMB), a member of FCMB Group Plc, is a financial services holding company headquartered in Lagos. FCMB Group Plc has nine subsidiaries divided among three business groups: commercial and retail banking, investment banking, and asset and wealth management. As of December 2020, the Group's total assets were valued at US $5 billion (NGN: 2 trillion). The entity from which the bank was founded, City Securities Limited (CSL), was established in 1977 by Oloye Subomi Balogun, the Otunba Tunwashe of Ijebu, a Yoruba traditional aristocrat. First City Merchant Bank was established in 1982 with seed capital from CSL. It was incorporated as a private limited liability company on 20 April 1982 and granted a banking license on 11 August 1983. It was the first bank to be established in Nigeria without government or foreign support. In 2001, the name of the bank was changed from First City Merchant Bank to First City Monument Bank Limited following the bank's transformation to a universal bank. A new subsidiary, FCMB Capital Markets Limited, was formed to support its corporate finance activities. On 15 July 2004, FCMB changed its status from a private limited liability company to a public limited liability company and was listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) by introduction on 21 December 2004.

First Bank of Nigeria Limited.description: First Bank of Nigeria Limited (First Bank) is a Nigerian multinational bank and financial services company headquartered in Lagos, Nigeria. It is the premier bank in West Africa. First Bank of Nigeria Limited operates as a parent company in Nigeria, with the subsidiaries 'FBN Bank' in the Republic of Congo, Ghana, The Gambia, Guinea, Sierra-Leone and Senegal; FBN Bank UK Limited in the United Kingdom with a branch in Paris; First Bank Representative Office in Beijing to capture trade-related business between geographies. First Bank also operates First Pension Custodian Nigeria Limited, Nigeria’s foremost pension custodian. The teeming customers of the First Bank Group are serviced from a network of over 700 business locations across Africa. To promote financial inclusion and reach the unbanked, First Bank has an extensive Agent Banking network, with over 53,000 locations across Nigeria. The Bank specializes in retail banking and has the largest client base in West Africa, with over 18 million customers. For eight consecutive years (2011 - 2018) First Bank Nigeria received the Best Retail Bank in Nigeria award by The Asian Banker. First Bank as a Group employs over 16,000 staff, and owns a multiple 'Best Place to Work awardee'. It operates four key Strategic Business Units (SBUs) – Retail Banking, Corporate Banking, commercial Banking, and Public Sector Banking. It was previously structured as an operating holding company before the implementation of a non-operating Holding Company structure (FBN Holdings) in 2011/2012.

Guaranty Trust Holding Company Plc.description: Guaranty Trust Holding Company PLC also known as GTCO PLC is a multinational financial services group, that offers retail and investment banking, pension management, asset management and payments services, headquartered in Victoria Island, Lagos. GTCO Plc was created in July 2021 following the corporate reorganization of Guaranty Trust Bank PLC into a Holding Company GTCO Plc's reorganisation means it will now offer more services beyond banking; with a payments business being top of mind for the group. Under its old structure, it could not have run non-lending businesses because a 2010 regulation by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) mandated banks to stop operating their non-banking subsidiaries. They either had to divest from non-core lending service or restructure as a holdings company. Its new businesses include payments, pension management, asset management, and its existing banking business. GTCO's banking subsidiary in Nigeria, Guaranty Trust Bank Limited is Nigeria’s most valuable bank by market value with its most recent market valuation at N840.26 billion. Guaranty Trust Holding Plc original started as Guaranty Trust banks and it was founded in 1988 by over 35 young Nigerians in their thirties, spearheaded mostly by Tayo Aderinokun and Fola Adeola, but also included Femi Pedro, Gbolade Osibodu, Femi Akingbe, Akin Opeodu and others.

Union Bank of Nigeria Plc.description: Union Bank of Nigeria Plc is a commercial bank in Nigeria. It has been operating in Nigeria since 1917. It's a large commercial bank, serving individuals, small and medium-sized companies, as well as large corporations and organizations. In July 2009, it was rated the 556th largest bank in the world and the 14th largest bank in Africa. As of Mar 31, 2018, the bank's asset base was estimated at NGN1, 381 billion (US$4.1billion). The shareholders' equity at that time was estimated at NGN286 billion (US$851 million).

United Bank for Africa Plc.description: United Bank for Africa Plc (UBA) is a Multinational pan-African financial services group headquartered in Lagos and known as Africa’s Global Bank. It has subsidiaries in 20 African countries and offices in London, Paris and New York. In December 2021, UBA received its banking license to commence operations in the UAE. It is listed as commercial bank by the Central Bank of Nigeria. The shares of stock of the group are listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange, where they trade under the symbol: UBA. The Group Chairman of the bank is Tony Elumelu and the GMD/CEO is Kennedy Uzoka.

Zenith Bank Plc.description: Zenith Bank Plc is a large financial service provider in Nigeria and Anglophone West Africa. It is licensed as a commercial bank by the Central Bank of Nigeria, the national banking regulator. As of 31 December 2019, it holds $16.1bn in total assets, with shareholders' equity of $854 million. The company is listed on the Nigeria Stock Exchange and the London Stock Exchange. The founder of Zenith bank plc is Jim Ovia. Zenith Bank was established in May 1990 and commenced banking operations in July of the same year. At inception, it had a capital base of $4 million. It began operations during a period of government liberalization of the banking sector when the central bank granted up to twenty banking licenses a year to investors. The bank's first office was originally a residential house in Victoria Island that was modified into a banking hall. In its early years, the bank witnessed a period of rapid growth. In 1997, following a directive for banking institutions to shore up their capital base, Zenith increased its capitalization to 500 million naira.

Commercial Banks 2.description:
This is a list of commercial banks with National Authorization in Nigeria, arranged alphabetically. 
 A commercial bank is a financial institution which accepts deposits from the public and gives loans for the purposes of consumption and investment to make profit.
